productText:
000
FZAK52 PAJK 151120
CWFAEG

Coastal Waters Forecast for Southeast Alaska
National Weather Service Juneau AK
320 AM AKDT Thu Jun 15 2023

Southeast Alaska Coastal Waters from Dixon Entrance to
Cape Suckling out 100 NM

Wind forecasts reflect the predominant speed and direction
expected. Seas forecasts represent the average of the highest
one-third of the combined windwave and swell height.

PKZ099-160530-
320 AM AKDT Thu Jun 15 2023
.SYNOPSIS FOR OUTSIDE WATERS...
A gale force front arrives on Thursday. Areas of northerly winds
in the panhandle will switch to southerly as the ridge breaks
down ahead of the front. East West channels will see enhanced
easterly winds Thursday afternoon and through the night into
Friday.  

$$

PKZ641-160530-
Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision out to 15 NM-
320 AM AKDT Thu Jun 15 2023

...GALE WARNING EARLY THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING...

.TODAY...SE wind 15 kt increasing to 35 kt. Seas 5 ft building to
10 ft. Rain.
.TONIGHT...S wind 35 kt diminishing to 25 kt. Gusts to 40 kt. 
Seas 9 ft. Rain.
.FRI...S wind 20 kt. Seas 11 ft. Showers.
.FRI NIGHT...S wind 20 kt. Seas 12 ft. SW swell. Showers.
.SAT...S wind 15 kt. Seas 11 ft. 
.SUN...NW wind 20 kt. Seas 7 ft. 
.MON...NW wind 20 kt. Seas 6 ft.
